text:
Situation A. Maren and Matt make a Claim

Examine each claim. Explain why it does or does not make sense.

Maren’s Claim

A graph shows that the relationship between the circumference and diameter of a circle is a proportional relationship.
Maren’s claim is correct. From class table and graph, you can find an equation, circumference = about 3 times diameter, which shows a proportional relation. A class graph may look like the following:

Matt’s Claim

I can use the radius of a circle to compute its circumference.
Matt could use the radius. He would have to double it to find the diameter, then multiply by 3.

Situation B. Using Circumference

The following problems involve circles.

  • Examine each problem and answer the questions. Explain your strategies.

Round Windows

The round window has a diameter of 6 ft. How much wooden trim is needed to surround the window?

18ft.

Strategies:

If you use an equation circumference = 3 x diameter, the circumference is 3 x 6 = 18 ft.

Or, if you use the ratio in the Initial Challenge, circumference/diameter = 3, circumference/6 = 3. So, the circumference is 18.

Skating Rinks

A skating rink is rectangular with a half circle at each end. How many meters of railing are needed to surround the rink?

85 meters.

The straight part of railing is 20m + 20m = 40m. And railing around two half circles becomes one entire circle of diameter 15 meters. Then the circumference of the circle is about 15 m x 3 = 45 m. So, it needs 40 m + 45 m = 85 m

Distance Around the World

The diameter of Earth is approximately 41,900,000 feet along the equator. If a 6 foot man walked around the Earth, how much further would his head move than his feet?

36ft.

The circumference of Earth is about 41,900,000 x 3 = 125,700,000 ft. The traveler’s trace of his head makes a bigger circle than Earth, which has the diameter of 41900012 ft. The circumference is 41,900,012 x 3 = 125,700,036 ft. Therefore, the difference is about 36 ft.

Another way to find the difference is using distributive property: 41,900,012 x 3 – 41,900,000 x 3 = (41,900,012 - 41,900,000) x 3 = 12x3 = 36.

Some students may want to draw a diagram to understand the problem.
